title: Scalable recommender system based on factor analysis
abstract:
Recommender systems have become crucial in the modern digital landscape,
where personalized content, products, and services are essential for enhancing
user experience. This paper explores statistical models for recommender
systems, focusing on crossed random effects models and factor analysis. We
extend the crossed random effects model to include random slopes, enabling the
capture of varying covariate effects among users and items. Additionally, we
investigate the use of factor analysis in recommender systems, particularly for
settings with incomplete data. The paper also discusses scalable solutions
using the Expectation Maximization (EM) and variational EM algorithms for
parameter estimation, highlighting the application of these models to predict
user-item interactions effectively.
